noun.description: A part of a song that is repeated after each verse, typically by more than one singer.
A large organized group of singers, especially one that performs together with an orchestra or opera company.
A simultaneous utterance of something by many people.
(in ancient Greek tragedy) a group of performers who comment on the main action, typically speaking and moving together.
A device used with an amplified musical instrument to give the impression that more than one instrument is being played.

verb.description: (of a group of people) say the same thing at the same time.

origin: Mid 16th century (denoting a character speaking the prolog of a play): from Latin, from Greek khoros.
